data.description: Description: Are you ready to spend your summer as part of something special? Imagine working with a Fortune 200 company whose reputation for excellence opens the door to endless opportunities. At Genuine Parts Company (GPC), we offer the chance to work with the best teams on innovative projects in a supportive and dynamic environment. Our employees build long-lasting, rewarding careers and make a real difference in the community. GPC was just awarded one of America’s Greatest Workplaces for Parents & Families by Newsweek. About the Program: Our 10-week summer internship program will be held in-person at our Atlanta headquarters, conveniently located near Windy Hill and I-75. The program runs from June to August 2026. As a technology intern, you will help solve complex business problems by leveraging technology and building scalable solutions. Interns can express their preferences for areas of interest and are assigned to teams based on prior experience and interviews. As digital analytics focused intern, you will work on digital analytics projects that will leverage AI/ GenAI to drive efficiencies and business impact in key areas such driving sales, improving margins, improving customer experience, satisfaction and their overall value to the business. You will work with internal cross-functional teams (Analytics, Ops, Merchandising, Product), to solve business problems and enhance operational efficiency and drive value from our investments in data and AI infrastructure. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to solve real business problems and drive value from our investments in data and AI infrastructure. Examples of projects include: Predictive Analytics: Build advanced machine learning models to forecast critical business metrics such as churn rate, customer lifetime value, sales trends, and demand forecasting to drive strategic decision-making. Classification Models: Develop AI solutions for categorizing customer behavior, product recommendations, risk assessment, and automated content classification to enhance operational efficiency. Customer Segmentation: Apply unsupervised learning techniques including clustering algorithms and dimensionality reduction to discover non-obvious customer segments and behavioral patterns that can unlock new business opportunities and personalization strategies. GenAI Integration: Implement Large Language Model (LLM) solutions via GenAI APIs to create innovative business applications such as: Conversational BI and automated insights generation Customer feedback analysis and workflow automation Intelligent recommendations and decision support systems Agentic AI solutions to activate insights across marketing, sales, and digital operations teams Required Experience and Skills Programming: Proficiency in Python, SQL, with experience in data manipulation, analysis, and model development. Machine Learning: Hands-on experience with ML frameworks (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) and solid understanding of supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, model evaluation, and validation techniques. Statistics & Data Science: Strong foundation in statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, advanced analytics, and experimental design. AI Technologies: Familiarity with GenAI APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini, or similar platforms) Understanding of LLM prompting strategies, finetuning techniques, and integration patterns Basic knowledge of AI agents, agentic workflows, and multi-agent systems Development Tools: Experience with AI coding assistants (GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Windsurf, or similar tools) and modern development practices. Nice to Have Knowledge of digital analytics platforms (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics) Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and their AI/ML services Exposure to MLOps practices, model deployment, and production ML systems Understanding of data engineering concepts and ETL processes The projects will be challenging and to help our interns be successful, we are seeking top talent which includes: Rising juniors and seniors (as of summer 2025) enrolled in an undergraduate program with a focus on computer science, digital merchandising, or related technology fields. Preference will be given to applicants with a GPA of at least 3.6. Experience in data analysis, customer experience, and digital operations. Demonstrated passion for learning and applying modern technology tools to create innovative solutions. What our interns can expect: Gain valuable experience and advance your skills while working for an iconic Atlanta-based Fortune 200 company. Network with highly respected Technology leaders (our CIDO and Technology VP’s meet regularly with the interns and attend presentations). These connections can prove invaluable in the job market. We have a highly collaborative work environment, and teammates participating in the intern program are onsite fulltime Monday through Friday. We include some fun company-sponsored events, like attending a Braves game, to help make the summer fun. Explore GPC’s rich history through field trips to various locations, including distribution centers and retail operations. Earn bragging rights, prizes, and opportunities to showcase your tech skills and learn more about a career in technology. Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by joining our Talent Community on jobs.genpt.com or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!GPC conducts its business without regard to sex, race, creed, color, religion, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, age, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, disability, military status, status as a veteran, or any other protected characteristic. GPC's policy is to recruit, hire, train, promote, assign, transfer and terminate employees based on their own ability, achievement, experience and conduct and other legitimate business reasons.
responsibilities: Classification Models: Develop AI solutions for categorizing customer behavior, product recommendations, risk assessment, and automated content classification to enhance operational efficiency.
Programming: Proficiency in Python, SQL, with experience in data manipulation, analysis, and model development.
Development Tools: Experience with AI coding assistants (GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Windsurf, or similar tools) and modern development practices.
Preference will be given to applicants with a GPA of at least 3.6.
